From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Cebuano

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Spanish aprobar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Hyphenation: a‧pro‧bar

Verb

[edit]

aprobar

  1. to approve

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin approbāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /apɾoˈbaɾ/ [a.pɾoˈβ̞aɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: a‧pro‧bar

Verb

[edit]

aprobar (first-person singular present apruebo, first-person singular preterite aprobé, past participle aprobado)

  1. to approve, to condone, to permit
    Antonym: desaprobar
  2. to pass (succeed, e.g. on an exam)
    Synonym: pasar
    Antonym: suspender

2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
